rules
Interface Rules

All Known Implementing Classes:
RulesImpl
public interface Rules

Interface that declare the methods that define the responsabilities of a Rule object. A Rule has one of the following shapes: 1) if (ANTECEDENT) then CONSECUENT . 2) if NOT (ANTECEDENT) then CONSECUENT . A Rule Object will belongs to a Knowledge Database (KDB). A Knowledge Database is a set of rules . It belongs to the public API.

Author:
Jorge Couchet

Method Detail

evaluatesRule

boolean evaluatesRule(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> rd,
                      java.util.List<AntElement> antecedent)
                      throws GggpExceptionImpl
The function evaluates the Rule's ANTECEDENT with one of the following shapes: 1) NOT ( (X1 Lmo Y1) Lo (X2 Lmo Y2) Lo ... Lo (X3 Lmo Y3) ) 2) ( (X1 Lmo Y1) Lo (X2 Lmo Y2) Lo ... Lo (X3 Lmo Y3) ) With: 1) Lmo = Logical Mathematical Operator, with Lmo = "==", "!=", "<", "<=", ">", ">=" 2) Lo = Logical Operator, with Lo = "AND", "OR" 3) Xi and Yi are real values (doubles)

Parameters:
rd - A mapping between the ANTECEDENT's string label and his corresponding real value.
antecedent - The ANTECEDENT to be evaluated.
Returns:
The boolean value corresponding to the Rule's ANTECEDENT evaluation.
Throws:
GggpExceptionImpl

getAntecedent

java.util.List<AntElement> getAntecedent()
Returns:
The Rule's ANTECEDENT.

setAntecedent

void setAntecedent(java.util.List<AntElement> a)
Associates the ANTECEDENT to the Rule.

Parameters:
a - The ANTECEDENT to be associated to the Rule.

getConsecuent

java.lang.String getConsecuent()
Returns:
The Rule's CONSECUENT.

setConsecuent

void setConsecuent(java.lang.String c)
Associates the CONSECUENT to the Rule.

Parameters:
c - The CONSECUENT to be associated to the Rule.
